basics.name: Kelly Hayn
basics.label: Assistant Director of Animal Operations
basics.summary: Kelly is a dedicated Animal Care Director with 15+ years experience in animal husbandry, training, and welfare. She has extensive knowledge in a wide variety of taxa and is adept at handling potentially dangerous animals with sensitivity and efficiency. She is an expert in guest relations and is accomplished at motivating staff in a team environment, often in a volunteer setting with a strong background in both for-profit and non-profit organizations.

work.name: The C.A.R.E. Foundation
highlights: Oversaw daily care of sanctuary animals, including habitat maintenance, feeding, behavioral observation, medication administration, husbandry and enrichment programs

Conducted on and off property educational programs with animal ambassadors, providing guests of all ages with up close and personal animal experiences and extensive knowledge of animal conservation and welfare
Trained all new incoming volunteers as well as provided guidance to existing volunteers, encouraging a team environment with innovative thinking and compassionate care for the animals
Oversaw expansion of social media presence with focus on community engagement and fundraising efforts
Built and maintained strong business relationships with active donors and sponsors, resulting in increased donations and sponsorships
Developed new fundraising ideas in addition to planning and coordinating large scale fundraising events and campaigns

work.name: Birds and Animals Unlimited
highlights: Applied operant conditioning to train a wide variety of animals for both live stage settings as well as movie production settings
Performed live entertainment experiences for audiences of over 2,000 guests in both formal and informal settings
Demonstrated strong partnering skills and team building during training projects and creative show presentation development
Efficiently performed all necessary daily tasks, including data keeping regarding behavior and nutrition, enrichment, medication administration, husbandry, and training of animals
Acted as liaison for USDA and FWC facility inspections and record keeping
